API Reference¶

seclea_ai.seclea_ai.py¶

class seclea_ai.seclea_ai.SecleaAI(project_name, plat_url='https://platform.seclea.com', auth_url='https://auth.seclea.com')¶

Bases: object

init_project(model_name: str, framework: str, dataset_name: str) → None¶

Wrapper or shortcut method that initializes the project. Sets model and dataset. Throws exception if dataset has not been uploaded.

Parameters

  • model_name – The name of the model.

  • framework – The framework being used. Currently only “sklearn” is supported.

  • dataset_name – The name of the dataset.

Returns

None

Example:

>>>
login() → None¶

Override login, this also overwrites the stored credentials in ~/.seclea/config.

Returns

None

Example:

>>>
set_dataset(dataset_name: str) → None¶

Set the dataset for the session. Checks if it has been uploaded, if not throws an Exception

Parameters

dataset_name – The name of the dataset.

Returns

None

Example:

>>>
set_model(model_name: str, framework: str) → None¶

Set the model for this session. Checks if it has already been uploaded. If not it will upload it.

Parameters

  • model_name – The name for the architecture/algorithm. eg. “GradientBoostedMachine” or “3-layer CNN”.

  • framework – The machine learning framework being used. eg. “sklearn” or “pytorch”

Returns

None

Example:

>>>
upload_dataset(dataset_path: str, dataset_name: str, metadata: Dict)¶

Uploads a dataset. Does not set the dataset for the session. Should be carried out before setting the dataset.

Parameters

  • dataset_path –

  • dataset_name –

  • metadata –

Returns

None TODO return something meaningful about the status of the upload

Example:

>>>
upload_training_run(model, transformations: List[Callable])¶

Takes a model and extracts the necessary data for uploading the training run.

Parameters

  • model – An sklearn Estimator model.

  • transformations – A list of functions that preprocess the Dataset.

Returns

None TODO return something meaningful about the upload.
